## GAD-7 vs DTC

When it comes to comparing mental health questionnaires such as GAD-7 and DTC, researchers often face an uphill task. The Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and Drinking to Cope (DTC) offer valuable insights, but comparing their questionnaire items can be time-consuming and subjective. Harmony, a software tool specifically designed for psychologists, simplifies this task by enabling efficient comparison of these instruments, thereby streamlining the process of harmonising them. # Harmony: A Game-Changer in the GAD-7 vs DTC Comparison Looking at GAD-7 vs DTC, Harmony uses natural language processing and generative AI models to provide a percentage match between each item in these questionnaires. The beauty of using Harmony for GAD-7 vs DTC harmony analysis is that it can process PDF documents directly. Researchers can easily drag and drop the instruments into Harmony's intuitive web interface, and the software will handle the rest. Moreover, Harmony is designed to handle multiple languages, another aspect that sets it apart in the GAD-7 vs DTC comparison process. # Optimising The GAD-7 vs DTC Comparative Study with Harmony By leveraging vast language models, Harmony is playing a pivotal role in making longitudinal and cohort studies more accessible. More specifically, in a GAD-7 vs DTC comparative study, this software can efficiently map the harmonisation of questionnaire items. In a sphere where precision and time-effectiveness are highly valued, such technology spells a significant change. Therefore, psychologists looking to streamline their GAD-7 vs DTC comparison tasks can significantly benefit from Harmony's sophisticated yet user-friendly platform.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and DTC

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and DTC into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just DTC into Harmony</a> - compare DTC with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
